content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function to clean the column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), ' ', '_'), '-', '_')
end
```
This function first converts the column name to lower case, removes leading and trailing whitespaces using `strip`, replaces all spaces with underscores using `replace` and finally replaces hyphens with underscores.
